Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 05:59AM Haljo95 wrote: My wife has stage IV metastatic triple negative.  She has been an RN for 12 years and we didn't know there was no cure until she was well into her chemo treatments.  Shame on us for not researching more in the beginning but as with many people I think we were holding onto the hope she would not be one of the statistics.  I found through research she would not be cured and pressed her Onc. for answers.  Only then did he say this would be a life time struggle for my wife.  It was very disturbing news so far into her treatments but the knowing has given her a different perspective on life and how she approaches each day.  I don't think knowing in the beginning would have changed her approach to treatment but I do believe she would have made different decisions about her work, social life and communication to our kids.
Posts.Title: Why do I feel we are being overlooked cmhartley blondiex46
